oai_dc:dc.dc:title: State Street, Bristol, Va.-Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: View of State Street in Bristol, Tennessee. Shows multi-story buildings, automobiles, and pedestrians. The Tennessee-Virginia state line runs down the center of the street. Card no. B-30.

Bristol was first settled in 1771 as Sapling Grove. It is located between Virginia and the Great Smoky Mountains. In July 1927, Ralph Peer, a talent scout for Victor Records came to Bristol in search of local talent. Peer's Bristol sessions rank among the most significant recordings in American musical history. At Bristol, he recorded the first country music star, Jimmie Rodgers. He also discovered the Carter Family who went on to become legends of country music.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Streets; Buildings; Automobiles; Business districts; Stores and shops; Shopping
